factText: LOS ANGELES, July 26 (Xinhua) -- California's Governor Jerry Brown declared Thursday a state of emergency in two counties in Southern California due to fast moving fires in the western U.S. state. Governor: ‘Imminent catastrophe’  California Gov. Jerry Brown declared a state of emergency Thursday for Riverside and Shasta counties in response to fires. Governor Brown has issued a State of Emergency for Shasta County due to the Carr Fire.

New shelter now open for evacuees.   ⬇️ #CranstonFire #RibbonFire #RiversideCounty. There is an evacuation location in Anza for those displaced by fires or because of power outage. factText: Residents in Redding & Shasta Lake area near Oasis Rd. & areas in North Redding are losing power. factText: The Sundial Bridge has not been damaged in the Carr Fire, but it is closed today as crews work to clean up ash and debris that has accumulated on it.

Fire officials say 65 structures have been destroyed by a fatal wildfire tearing through rural Northern California towns. That's up from a previous report of 15 destroyed. CARR FIRE: At least 65 structures have been destroyed and 55 are damaged in the devastating wildfire in Shasta County. Thousands have evacuated as the blaze doubled in size overnight to 44,450 acres.

The #CarrFire doubled in size overnight, containment numbers went down and mandatory evacuations continue through many areas of the community. More evacuation orders have been ordered tonight over the #CarrFire, this time for residents south of Highway 299 and west of Swasey Drive in the area of the blaze. Mandatory evacuations were underway in the Carr Fire in Redding, California, as the wildfire swept over the Sacramento River and into neighborhoods.

(AP) — An explosive wildfire raged through several Northern California communities, killing two firefighters and destroying dozens of homes after thousands of terrified residents fled .
